sen.j: 金田城（かねだじょう、かねたのき）は、飛鳥時代に対馬国に築かれた古代山城（朝鮮式山城）。
sen.e: Kaneda-jo Castle (Kaneta no ki) is an ancient mountain castle (Korean style mountain castle) built in Tsushima Province during the Asuka Period.
Kaneda-jo Castle (also known as Kanetanoki Castle) is an ancient mountain castle (Korean-style mountain castle) built in Tsushima Province during the Asuka Period.

sen.j: 所在地は長崎県対馬市美津島町黒瀬城山。
sen.e: It is located in Joyama, Kurose, Mitsushima-machi, Tsushima City, Nagasaki Prefecture.

sen.j: 対馬の中部にある浅茅湾の南岸に突き出た標高275メートルの城山（じょうやま）に位置する。
sen.e: Kaneda-jo Castle is situated on Joyama 275 meters above sea level which stands on the south shore of Aso Bay in the central Tushima.

sen.j: 山頂部に石塁、山の周囲を取り巻くように石垣が築かれている。
sen.e: There are stone mounds on the top of Joyama and stonewalls were built to encircle that hill.

sen.j: 南東麓は比較的緩やかな斜面で、海に通じる三本の谷（北から順に「一の城戸」「二の城戸」「三の城戸」）には城壁が残っている。
sen.e: The southeastern foothill forms a relatively slow slope and there are castle walls along the 3 dales leading to the sea (that are referred to as 'First Castle Door,' 'Second Castle Door' and 'Third Castle Door,' respectively) that still remain in existence today.

sen.j: さらに水門と城門が設けられていたと考えられている。
sen.e: It is considered that a lock and castle gate also existed.

sen.j: また、「二の城戸」と「三の城戸」の中間に位置する「ビングシ山」周辺から複数の建物跡が発見されており、防人宿舎など中枢機能があったと考えられている。
sen.e: Additionally, a number of remains of buildings were discovered around Mt. Bingushi situated between 'Second Castle Door' and 'Third Castle Door' whereby it is considered that a major facility such as lodging houses for Sakimori (soldiers garrisoned at strategic posts in Kyushu in ancient times) existed in that area.

sen.j: 663年の白村江の戦いに敗れた倭国は唐・新羅に対する防衛のため、西日本各地に防衛施設を築いた。
sen.e: After losing the Battle of Hakusukinoe in 663, Wakoku (Japan) built defense facilities in various western regions to secure the country against Tang (China) and Silla (Korea).

sen.e: As part of the said security measure, Kaneda-jo Castle was built to become the forefront to defend the Korean Peninsula.
